metadata.case_name: Writ Petition No. 385 of 1969 & Civil Appeals Nos. 601-605 and 954-955 of 1972 & Writ Petition No. 218 of 1970
metadata.case_number: Writ Petitions Nos. 385 of 1969 and 218 of 1970; Civil Appeals Nos. 601 to 605 and 954, 955 of 1972

facts.text: Engineering Service in erstwhile State of Hyderabad consisted of State Service (Class I: Chief Engineer, Superintending Engineer, Executive Engineer, Assistant Engineers; Class II: Sub-Engineers) and Subordinate Service (Supervisors, Sub-Overseers, etc.).

Hyderabad Rules (notified 28th May 1954): Sub-Overseers filled by direct recruitment with LCE, LME, LEE or equivalent; Supervisors 50% direct (graduates or equivalent diploma), 50% promotion from Sub-Overseers with 6 years service if holding US/OCE; Sub-Engineers wholly by promotion from Supervisors (50% graduates with 6 years, 50% non-graduates with 15 years + departmental exam).
Petitioners-appellants held US/OCE certificates from Osmania Engineering College, recruited as Sub-Overseers, promoted to Supervisors prior to 1st November 1956 (except one).
Reorganization of States on 1st November 1956 under States Reorganisation Act 1956; Telangana area of Hyderabad added to Andhra forming Andhra Pradesh.

In erstwhile Andhra (from Madras): Engineering Service had State Service (up to Assistant Engineers) and Subordinate Service (Supervisors, Overseers etc., no Sub-Overseers); Andhra Rules (1953): Overseers qualified with degree/diploma/US/LCE etc.; Supervisors direct or promotion; Assistant Engineers promotions from Junior Engineers/Supervisors/Draftsmen with varying service (5-20 years based on qualification). No Sub-Engineers.

Post-reorg: Hyderabad Supervisors equated to Junior Engineers/Supervisors in AP; Provisional common gradation list 20th April 1963, final 23rd November 1967 retrospective to 1st Nov 1956; non-graduates (petitioners) in second part.
Sub-Engineers (Hyderabad) abolished post-1st Nov 1956; existing promoted to Assistant Engineers w.e.f. 31st Oct 1956 afternoon, placed en bloc below regular AEs.
Order 7th April 1960: Hyderabad employees governed by Hyderabad Rules for one stage promotion post-1st Nov 1956, subsequent by AP Rules.
Order 3rd Oct 1960: US/OCE Osmania equated to OCE/LS Guindy (lower). Protests; Special Committee 21st Apr 1961, State Board 1st Jun 1962 confirm not equivalent to LCE/LME/LEE.
Order 14th Feb 1963: Confirms US/OCE Osmania not equivalent to LCE etc., but recognized for Overseers.

AP Engineering Service Rules 1966 (22nd Feb 1967): Supersedes prior; promotions to AE: 37.5% direct, 62.5% transfer (2/3 from Group A Junior Enggs, 1/3 Group B Supervisors etc.; cyclic order favoring higher quals). Amended 12th Jan 1968: worse ratio.
High Court judgments: Dismissed writs (23rd Feb 1968, 21st/29th Jan 1972); SLPs rejected 27th Feb 1969.
WP 218/1970: Petitioners hold LCE, directly recruited Supervisors in Andhra/AP; challenge AP Rules discrimination graduates vs non-grads.

legal_issues.text: Whether US/OCE certificates of Osmania Engineering College equivalent to LCE/LME/LEE diplomas.
Whether application of Andhra/AP Rules varied conditions of service re promotion to disadvantage without Central Govt prior approval u/s 115(7) proviso States Reorg Act.
Whether promotion from Supervisor to Assistant Engineer is 'one stage promotion' governed by Hyderabad Rules per order 7 Apr 1960 and Rule 42(h)(i) AP State Service Rules 1962.
Whether AP Rules discriminate between categories of non-graduate Supervisors violating Art 14.
Whether AP Rules discriminate between graduate and non-graduate Supervisors violating Art 14 (WP 218/1970).

petitioner_arguments.text: Orders 3 Oct 1960, 14 Feb 1963 (confirmed GOI 17 Mar 1966) erroneously treat US/OCE Osmania as inferior to LCE etc.
Under Hyderabad Rules, entitled to 50% Sub-Engineers (equated to AEs); Andhra/AP Rules reduce to 1/3 then 1/18/1/24, varying conditions disadvantageously without Central approval u/s 115(7) proviso.
Promotion Supervisor to AE is one stage (Sub-Engr equated AE), governed by Hyderabad Rules per 7 Apr 1960 order & Rule 42(h)(i) APSS Rules 1962; promotions to be reviewed.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Hyderabad Rules; AP State & Subordinate Service Rules 1962 Rule 42(h)(i)

petitioner_arguments.text: AP Rules discriminate among non-graduate Supervisors by cyclic rotation violating Art 14.
AP Rules discriminate graduates (3:1 ratio initially) vs non-grads violating Art 14 (WP 218/1970).

respondent_arguments.text: US/OCE Osmania not equivalent to LCE etc., confirmed by expert committees, State Board, GOI.
Changes affect chances of promotion, not right to be considered; Central memo 11 May 1957 gives prior approval for promotion conditions.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: States Reorganisation Act s.115(7) proviso; Central memo 11 May 1957

respondent_arguments.text: One stage from Supervisor is Sub-Engineer (abolished); no direct to AE under Hyderabad Rules; Rule 42(h)(i) inapplicable.

court_reasoning.text: Equivalence is technical; Govt decision based on expert State Board of Technical Education not perverse; even in Hyderabad, US/OCE inferior (longer service, no direct to Supervisor); GOI affirmed.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Court defers to expert body unless irrational/perverse.

court_reasoning.text: Right to be considered for promotion is condition of service, but mere chances not; rules reduced chances from 50% to 1/24 but not right; supported by precedents.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Changes in chances of promotion not variation of conditions.

court_reasoning.text: Central memo 11 May 1957 gives general prior approval to variations in promotion conditions u/s 115(7); affirms Raghavendra Rao, overrules contrary views in Bhakar etc.
Sub-Engineer (one stage) abolished, not equated to AE; promotion to AE not contemplated in Hyderabad Rules; Rule 42(h)(i) inapplicable as no qualification under Hyderabad for direct Supervisor to AE.
Classification based on qualifications valid under Art 14/16; permits differential treatment for efficiency.

holdings.text: US/OCE Osmania not equivalent to higher diplomas; Govt decision upheld.
Andhra/AP Rules do not violate s.115(7) proviso; changes affect chances not conditions; Central memo gives approval.
Promotion to AE not governed by Hyderabad Rules; no one stage equivalence.

precedents_cited.relevance: Right to consideration vs chances of promotion as condition of service.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of Mysore v. G.B. Purohit
precedents_cited.relevance: Chances of promotion not conditions of service.

precedents_cited.case_name: Ramchandra Shankar Deodhar v. State of Maharashtra
N. Raghavendra Rao v. Deputy Commissioner, South Kanara
precedents_cited.relevance: Central memo 11 May 1957 is previous approval u/s 115(7).

precedents_cited.case_name: G.D. Vaid v. State of Punjab
State of Haryana v. S.J. Bahadur
N. Subba Rao v. Union of India

statutes_cited.name: States Reorganisation Act, 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Proviso requires Central approval for disadvantageous variation in conditions of service post-reorg.

statutes_cited.name: Andhra Pradesh Engineering Service Rules, 1966
statutes_cited.relevance: Mode of recruitment/promotion to Assistant Engineers; challenged as discriminatory.

statutes_cited.name: Andhra Pradesh State and Subordinate Service Rules, 1962
statutes_cited.relevance: Protects one stage promotion under old rules.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed the writ petitions and appeals, upholding the equivalence decisions, validity of promotion rules under States Reorganisation Act s.115(7), no one stage promotion applicability, and no Art 14 violation.

key_quotes.text: "Any rule which affects the promotion of a person relates to his condition of service. But when we speak of a right to be considered for promotion, we must not confuse it with mere chance of promotion-the latter would certainly not be a condition of service."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Distinguishes right vs chance of promotion under s.115(7).

key_quotes.text: "chances of promotion are not conditions of service."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "the expression previous approval would include a general approval to the variation in the conditions of service within certain limits, indicated by the Union Government."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Interprets Central memo as prior approval.
